Rayman Origins is a giant disappointment for me. While the artwork, soundtrack, and gameplay are amazing, in the end this game is a buggy mess. Over the course of my 7 hours played the game crashed multiple times, soft locked at least 5 times, and then decided to corrupt my save data. As if that wasn't bad enough the game also has a level of tedium to it that's incredibly frustrating and time consuming. Calculating the score at the end of each level feels like an eternity of waiting. To make matters even worse, if you don't get most, if not all of the collectables then the game denies you access to the final levels/ bosses of the game. Honestly if you want a Rayman game go play Rayman Legends. Not only does Legends improve everything, It also has the Rayman Origin levels in it! 

Just go buy Rayman Legends.

40541393.review:
Alala, Rayman Origins. Que dire de ce jeu sublime que j'ai pu teste à la paris games week de 2011. Le Rayman de mon enfance est de retour pour une nouvelle aventure. Soit-disant la suite du 3, Rayman Origins reprend beaucoup d'éléments du premier Rayman, notamment dans l'univers coloré et original des instruments gigantesques, jungles, océans et autres environnements inspirés et tirés de la direction artistique de Michel Ancel, déjà responsable du premier et du deuxième Rayman (moins dans le troisième vu qu'il était sur Beyond Good and Evil).

Un jeu de plateforme à l'ancienne, qui revient aux sources, est accueillit à bras ouvert par le grand public et les fans. Lorsque ceux-ci se rendent compte que le gameplay remplace l'histoire, un mauvais souvenirs de lapins crétins en resurgit. Mais cet avis fut vite oublié dès les premières heures de jeu, avec un flexibilité et une rejouabilité à toute épreuve.

Un jeu qui avait pour but de sortir en épisodes...

Tout d'abord terminé sur ps3, je m'y suis repenché lors de sa sortie sur PC et j'ai tout de suite accroché (grâce à la manette car sinon c'est pas top). Comptez au moins une quarantaine d'heures pour tout finir à 100%, sans l'aide de compagnons de route en coop lan, qui pourront vous débuller à volonté et vous chopper les petits lums que vous n'avez pas récupérés...

En somme un très bon jeu, qui manque d'histoire, mais qui contre ceci par beaucoup de fan service et d'easter eggs, mais aussi de graphismes haute qualité grâce à l'Ubi-Art framework, nouveau soft d'Ubisoft qui inspirera Valiant Hearts et Rayman Legends. Mais ça, nous n'en parlerons pas ici.

Le seul truc à faire sur pc c'est des backups des sauvegardes qui peuvent se corrompre facilement. :/

Courrez l'acheter, c'est un classique !
(Offert quelques fois sur Uplay)

40436794.review:
Who needs antidepressants? 

I was at a low emotional point when I played "Rayman Origins," and its colourful, playful world got past my cynicism and won me over. The game is excellent, consistently creative and challenging while also being forgiving. If you're not won over by the art and the music (and those singing Looms), you'll at least be won over by the platforming.

"Rayman Legends," which I own on PS3, was just as good. They're fun as single-player, fun as local multiplayer, fun for a party. It's bewildering that the games industry largely ignored "Origins" and "Legends"...but, ah, well, at least we had these two.

They still cheer me up when I'm down.

40342761.review:
[h1]+Positives+[/h1]

+The artstyle is really REALLY nice. Everything is so rubbery, it reminds me of a repolished 1953 slapstick cartoon for some reason.

+Great amount of detail in the background of every level.

+Nice and vibrant visuals

+The animations for the characters are so smooth and like I said before, rubbery. I would have never thought that I would have so much fun seeing the characters do front flips in the loading screen.

+A platformer that definitely promotes speed-running and finding different ways to go around an obstacle.

+Don't like speed-running? No worries, the game doesn't scould you for taking things slow and finding secrets.

+The soundtrack is very whimsical, but has a lot of catchy tunes.

[h1]-Negatives-[/h1]

-Bosses are really boring and dull, almost all of them are just hit the glowing weakspot a certain amount of times and they're dead.

-The game oversexualizes fairies. It may be a good thing for those who like masturbating to cartoons, I find it to be a negative for children who might actually be playing this "E Rated" game and not only that but it's actually really uncomfortable to watch.

-Game doesn't really reward you for beating it other than the added challenge of beating The Land Of The Livid Dead, which if you manage completing it, you're still going to be rewarded with almost nothing other than bragging rights.

-Progressing towards unlocking The Land Of The Livid Dead is absolute ASS. You'll need to obtain "smiley-badges?" which you get by rescuing electoons (There are three you'll need to save in each level and they're all secretly hidden), collecting lums, or completing a time-trial. After you get enough "smiley-badges", you unlock a little bonus level, that's found in every world that has you going through some fast-paced action that rewards you with a skull tooth that you give to this one guy who opens the Land Of The Livid Dead for you as soon as you get 10 skull teeth.

-Game doesn't have a good ending. It's really just a case of final boss defeated>roll credits. I get that this a review and it shouldn't be biased but unlocking The Land Of The Livid Dead is really just a big time waster, I've beat the game and I thought beating The Land Of The Livid Dead would give me the true ending to the game so I kept my eye's peeled for the electoons and lums to get those 10 skull teeth. Unlocked the level, took me about 2 hours to beat, and disappointment. No ending just the credits.

[h1]-+Neutral+-[/h1]

-+The game's humor will appeal to others or just annoy others.

-+Keyboard controls are great, but they do require some remapping because the original control scheme for keyboard is really wonky.

[h1]--Final Verdict--[/h1]
Aside from all the negatives, the game is actually a blast to play both alone and with friends and having a Rayman game on Steam is actually really great, especially for someone who's familiar with the older games. Is the $20 price tag worth it though? I'd say wait for a sale or get it for free if you can, the game isn't very long and the poor ending along with no rewards kind of removes any replay value from this game, so you really won't be spending that much time on it. The game isn't very forgiving for those new to the platformer genre, it's a lot more suited towards players who are extremely familiar with the genre, so if you're looking into getting your first platformer I recommend not getting Rayman Origins because you might end up break something.

40095164.review:
I truly, honestly love this game. I haven't had this much fun in ages, and it takes me back in time when I was a kid and strived to beat that very level just because I wanted it. There has not to be a precise purpose in going on, and that is what makes the difference between a mediocre game and a great game: playing it because it's plain fun and not because there's "some more to see".

Rayman Origins falls in the latter category. Don't really know why, but I just want to play it. Not even the ice levels are frustrating: there IS a way to handle EVERYTHING efficiently, you just have to find it.

The treasure bonus levels, for example: I've seen many people having difficulties with them, but I can breeze through them without really explaining why - maybe experience. Not only with a "Sonic the Hedgehog in his golden era" kind of speed but also with Rayman himself, the first title in the franchise, where you had to calculate your jump exactly on the edge of the platform to reach the next one. And oh, the controls are just perfect, very responsive and precise. THIS is what I want from a platformer.

Too bad Ubisoft seems to be enthralled with some (really) quirky and shady DRM politics or weird pay-to-play antics. I'm still evaluating wether or not purchasing Legends, because Uplay, let's be honest, is a pain in the butt. Also that "no Internet - no play" thing really makes me angry. What if I have no connection AND I want to play? They seemed so accountable at first, but now I think I am just going to wait and see what happens.

Anyway, Rayman seems not to have inherited any of these traits, so that's all right and well. Highly recommended if you want a really creative, unique and stylish platformer, and also if you want some serious difficulty to deal with.

39581396.review:
Rayman Origins è stato per me semplicemente una gioia. Uno di quei platform ben curati dallo stile grafico eccezionale, animazioni curatissime e un sacco di abilità che si sbloccano mano mano che vengono incontro a un level design coi fiocchi. Oltretutto il nonsense abbonda in ogni fase di gioco ed è palese che alla Ubisoft abbiano utilizzato davvero della buona erba prima di mettersi a programmare, altrimenti non si spiega la follia che sta dietro a questo capitolo (ormai datato, sono tremendamente in ritardo) di Rayman.
Tra le mille risate che ho fatto giocando l'avventura interamente in compagnia di un amico, con cui scambiavamo ceffoni, collaboravamo per riuscire a superare i livelli più difficili e facevamo a gara a chi riuscisse a essere più cretino, è impossibile non notare la cura che è stata riposta dagli sviluppatori per realizzare livelli sempre ben costruiti, vari e ricchi di dettagli; a partire dal peculiare stile grafico che dà vita a fondali ricchi e ambientazioni entusiasmanti e con una colonna praticamente eccezionale che non mancherò di aggiungere alla mia playlist, Rayman Origins è una bellezza da giocare, da vedere e da ascoltare.
Se devo davvero puntualizzare dei difetti in questa produzione non posso assolutamente fare a meno di notare che, in qualità di titolo Ubisoft, i bug abbondano: a volte capita di morire senza motivo, gli script che gestiscono le apparizioni degli ostacoli talvolta ritardano a funzionare, può succedere di prendere danni senza un vero perchè e il modo con cui il gioco gestisce i personaggi fuori dai bordi dello schermo è piuttosto erratico (talvolta abbiamo il tempo di recuperare terreno, in altre occasioni si muore istantaneamente, perchè?), soprattutto capita con una certa frequenza che i controlli non rispondano agli input. Sempre sui controlli, essi sono abbastanza morbidi e flessibili, ma siamo ben lontani dalla precisione di un Super Mario qualunque. Non si tratta di niente che non possa essere superato in co-op, ma nell'avventura in singolo potrebbero arrecare un po' di fastidio. 
Un'altra caratteristica che non ho pienamente apprezzato è il livello di difficoltà che ha picchi esagerati coincidenti con le corse del tesoro: livelli in cui bisogna correre superando gli ostacoli con precisione millimetrica e che non lasciano spazio nè al minimo errore nè a nessun grado di flessibilità, in altre parole vanno fatti rigidamente nel modo previsto dagli sviluppatori. Livelli per certi versi divertenti, per carità, e mai impossibili, ma è necessario fare molti tentativi per superarli e insomma, il resto del gioco scorre via senza particolari problemi. Pur opzionali, cosa ottieni completandoli tutti? Un livello extra stupidamente difficile e senza checkpoint che ci ricompensa con... niente. E vabbè.
Ho decisamente apprezzato invece i livelli shoot 'em up, un ottimo cambio di registro rispetto al solito platforming. I boss non sono poi così creativi e non sono neanche particolarmente interessanti nelle meccaniche, ma per fortuna sono pochi e si sconfiggono senza problemi.
Rayman Origins è insomma un titolo che consiglio a piene mani: costa poco, è fatto bene salvo certe sbavature, è follemente divertente e giocandolo con un amico accanto ci si sganascia dal ridere, peccato solo per l'assenza del multiplayer online. Duecento pollici in su.

39302192.review:
[b]tl;dr[/b]
All the components of this game are great, yet somehow I never enjoyed the game and completing the levels just felt like a chore.

[b]Full Review[/b]
My partner and I are always on the look out for fun, casual, local co-op games. However 2D platformers are always a difficult genre to know what you are getting as there is such a broad spectrum of difficulty. On the one hand you have stuff aimed at very young children where you bounce round the levels with no real peril or satisfaction then at the other extreme you have games for the peculiarly masochistic hard core gamers where the levels are relentlessly unforgiving. This game is tagged as family friendly so we were expecting something on the easy end of the spectrum... oh how wrong we were.

The game starts with a cutscene showing the protagonists smoking unspecified substances and being loud and disruptive. Having lived next to anti-social neighbours in the past I couldn't help but wonder if we were playing as the villains in this game who have just tormented those around them to breaking point. But anyway none of that matters as there isn't really much plot to this game, just keep running to the right.

The first levels are great, the artwork is excellent, the controls are very tight, the music is perfect, there is a nice variety of obstacles and enemies, the levels are divided into nice short sections, there is a simple health system where you teammates can rescue you and new abilities are introduced gradually by rescuing incongruously curvaceous fairies. All in all it was an extremely well polished game.

I think it was towards the end of the second world we started to lose interest as it was just more difficult than expected. The game was not providing the casual relaxation we were looking for, it was just an unrewarding grind to get through the levels. So it was around this point my partner gave up, I'm more bloody-minded so I ploughed on but unfortunately on your own there is no one to rescue you when you die so it gets even more difficult.

In each level you collect these yellow insects and if you get enough you get a pink blob thing. We started off trying to collect these but in order to collect enough you need to get you difficult to reach coins so this often ended up with one of us trying the get the coin whist the other just stood there to rescue them when they failed. This slows down the game and makes it boring so we just left that for the obsessive completists. However once I progressed further in the game it turns out you need a certain number of those pink blobs to unlock the boss fights so I had to tediously go back through various levels to collect enough.

The point where I drew the line was the last level. This was where the difficulty increased to the point there was no trace of fun left. You basically have to keep playing and failing till you memorise every obstacle and exactly what moves to make when. There is also a final bonus level if you collect even more pink blobs and complete all the other bonus levels, which having watched a video of, looks more like Sisyphean torture than entertainment.

So I really didn't enjoy this game and despite it being tagged as family friendly I'm pretty sure that when I was a child I would never have had enough patience for this game.

37359462.review:
One of the best platformers of all time, this game is filled with a fun and creative enviroment that is enjoyable for all ages. 
With a whimsical story and characters that speak pig latin this is a game to play inside on a rainy day that will make you just feel wonderful about life. The level design is insanely creative with twists added to the themes that make them unique and with platforming elements that dont seem forced but are just typical of the enviroment.
 
The difficulty of this game is notable and scales drastically towards the end of the game, with a specific shoutout to the Land of the Livid Dead (A difficult to unlock level that requires near perfect movement to complete) and collecting all the lums in a level can feel impossible or a test of trial and error but dont despair! This game is simple at its core and all the more beautiful for it, never does it feel like an impossible task or that the game is asking too much from you. The pacing in this game is so well done and keeps fun as the main objective at all times.

35615050.review:
Наконец-то этот великолепный платформер доступен в русском Стиме! Всем любителям платформеров категорически рекомендую.

Что можно сказать о Rayman Origins? Это: красивая рисованная графика (а значит отличная производительность), отличная и запоминающаяся музыка, в меру сложный геймплей и отсутствие лишних раздражающих элементов, появившихся в продолжении.

Отмечу также и несколько неприятных, но некритичных моментов.
[list]
[*]Идеальное прохождение некоторых уровней (особенно летающих) требует многократных попыток, даже для опытного игрока (связано это с необходимостью заучить весь уровень и расположение врагов, а потом ещё выбрать идеальную тактику). Возможно, они просто рассчитаны на кооператив, но это не оправдывает такую сложность. В первую очередь это касается последнего мира, в остальных мне удалось получить все награды. Но если не заморачиваться прохождением на результат, игра не требует хардкорных навыков.
[*]Открытие последнего персонажа требует собрать всех электунсов, то есть его можно открыть только пройдя игру, когда он уже не нужен.
[*]Накопление сильного удара требует слишком много времени (исправлено в продолжении)
[*]По моим ощущениям, управление немного неотзывчиво
[/list]
Также рекомендую Rayman Legends.

33651963.review:
Over the past year, I’ve played through well over a hundred platformers ranging from the Atari 2600 to the modern gen.  I honestly needed a proverbial shot in the arm to regain my passion for gaming, so I decided to focus on my favorite genre for awhile.  Even so, among the countless platformers that I’ve played, Rayman Origins is near the top.  As far as modern, non-indie games go, it absolutely tears through the admittedly small (volume-wise) competition.  The “New” Super Mario Bros. series is the Mega Bloks to Rayman’s metaphorical Legos.  As in, one of them doesn’t fit / feel quite right while the other is practically infallible.

    Rayman Origins is a master class for what I like to call the "floaty" platformer genre.  The controls are fluid to the point of absurdity.  The developers clearly spent time garnering their own unique feel, rather than simply copying the mechanics of platformers of the past, and it paid off beautifully.  What’s more, the sound design complements the gameplay in a way that can only be truly understood by actually experiencing it first-hand.  Even if the game’s aesthetics weren’t as wonderful as they are, I would still wholeheartedly encourage anyone to pick this up.  It doesn't matter if they're not a fan of the genre.  In fact, this would be a great place to start.
    
    One caveat though.  Rayman Legends, the sequel to this, includes about two thirds of the levels featured in this game as “remastered” versions.  That makes Legends the better deal monetarily.  However, I find that Origins’ level progression flows better than Legends.  So actually, just buy both and be enjoy yourself.  Because it doesn’t really get much better than this.

32962088.review:
One of my favorite 2D platformers (and the sequel Rayman Legends is even better, but get this one too). Gorgeous hand-drawn art, great music, plenty of secret collectibles to find, and fantastic level design (in particular I love the treasure chest chasing levels and the secret final Land of the Livid Dead level). Controlling Rayman and pals just feels so good, especially once you get the wall running ability, and the frequent checkpoints and lack of lives keep the game from ever getting frustrating.

I also love Rayman's approach to 4-player co-op, stealing the good bits from games like New Super Mario Bros. Wii (bubbling, messing with your friends), while improving on the parts that made it frustrating (bumbling into and accidentally jumping on each other constantly). Seriously, when I tried out New Super Mario Bros. U a couple years ago it was almost physically painful how often my co-op partner and I would get in each other's way without meaning to. 32294352.review:
[h1]Rayman Origins hüpft über viele andere Jump&Run-Spiele hinweg! [/h1]

Rayman und seine Freunde schnarchen auf der Lichtung der Träume vor sich hin und stören dadurch die Nachbarin. Die alte Dame fühlt sich dadurch derartig gestört, dass sie alles was sie finden kann auf die Lichtung wirft. Dadurch landen Tische, Stühle, der Schädel von ihrem Ehemann und noch viel mehr auf der Gruppe. Durch tieffliegende Gegenstände vertrieben macht sich Rayman auf den Weg die alte Ordnung wieder herzustellen.

Im Laufe des Spieles erhält Rayman von den fünf Nymphen neue Fähigkeiten, beispielsweise lernt er zu tauchen, Wände hochzurennen oder auch einfach nur um sich zu schlagen. 
Dadurch ergeben sich immer wieder neue Leveltypen, die mit längerer Spielzeit immer schwerer werden. Vor allem die letzten Level haben mich einige Nerven gekostet und ich hätte meinen Controller gerne quer durch den Raum geworfen. 

Die bunte Grafik und der tolle Soundtrack tragen ihren sehr guten Teil zu dem Spiel bei, das Level- und Figurendesign gefällt mir super gut.

Nach einer halben Ewigkeit habe ich das Spiel zu 100% beendet. Würde mir das Spiel nicht gefallen hätte ich mir die Mühe sicher nicht gemacht.
Somit kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen. Wenn man bunte Grafik und fordernde, aber nicht völlig unmöglich scheinende, Jump&Runs mag erst Recht.

31357955.review:
Primo dei due capitoli della melanzana manesca col motore UbiArt Framework, Rayman Origins è un eccellente 2D platform che riprende molto appunto dalle "origini" del brand in alcune parti del gameplay, come i poteri sbloccabili mano a mano che si va avanti nel gioco. Il punto di forza di Rayman Origins è il level design: lo stato dell'arte del platform fast-paced, ogni livello è un piccolo capolavoro di punti d'appoggio, trampolini, nemici ed ostacoli tutti messi esattamente nei punti esatti e tutti a tema coi livelli (ad esempio i trampolini a fettine di lime nei livelli ghiacciati sono stupendi). Walljump, corse sui muri, brutti ceffi da prendere a manate, tutto a mille all'ora. Non mancano aree bonus e vari collezionabili. Graficamente eccezionale, un tripudio di colori e un feeling generale da "cartone animato interattivo" in 2k e a 60 FPS, che purtroppo non ho potuto godere a pieno a cuasa di rate drop dovuti al mio PC ormai da rifare da zero.
Come contro per me sono i livelli shmup orizzontale a cavallo del mosquito, è un sottogenere che proprio non mi piace, e le boss battles: le hitbox dei boss risultano essere abbastanza più grandi dello sprite e i loro pattern d'attacco all'inizio sono un po' criptici, quindi battibili solo via trial&error.

Assolutamente consigliato agli amanti del genere come me.

30468028.review:
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/12/rayman-1.html?q=Rayman]Recensione Rayman[/url]
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/10/rayman-2-pc.html?q=Rayman]Recensione Rayman 2: The great escape (pc)[/url]
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/12/rayman-m.html?q=Rayman]Recensione Rayman M[/url]
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/12/rayman-3.html?q=Rayman]Recensione Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/fabro2099/recommended/15080/] Recensione Rayman Ravings Rabbids[/url]

Un platform dove ricorda veramente le "origini" del primo Rayman (vari nemici, acquisire i poteri piano piano, qualche ambientazione).
La difficoltà del gioco è sulla norma, si inizierà dai livelli facili fino a quelli un pò difficili.
Le ambientazioni sono molto originali (qualcuno ricorda pure Tonic Trouble) e verranno accompagnate perfettamente con le soundtrack del gioco, orecchiabilissimi con una "carineria" unica.
La mancanza dell'online è un problema bello grosso, perchè questo gioco lo si riesce ad apprezzare al 100% in compagnia con qualcuno.
Per quanto riguarda la longevità pure essa viene criticata, il gioco lo si può finire in 6 ore. Io non so quanto potrei criticarla, in un platform 2D potrebbe stancare giocarvelo ancora più a lungo, secondo me il tempo di durata è giusto.

[h1]PRO[/h1]
-[b]Grafica 2D[/b] egregia che caratterizza perfettamente i personaggi del gioco
-[b]Gameplay[/b] in molte parti ricordano vagamente il primo Rayman (fortunatamente il livello di difficoltà è sulla norma)
-[b]Ambientazioni[/b] molto ben realizzati
-[b]Soundtrack[/b] tra le più memorabili e orecchiabili mai sentite

[h1]NEUTRO[/h1]
-[b]Qualche ambientazione[/b] in più non sarebbe guastata
-[b]Qualche boss[/b] in più non sarebbe guastato

[h1]CONTRO[/h1]
-[b]Mancanza dell'online cooperativo[/b]
-[b]Giocarlo da soli non lo si riesce ad apprezzare al 100%[/b]

[h1]Conclusione[/h1]
Per i fan di Rayman è obbligatorio prenderlo, per i non-fan invece può essere un ottima occasione per farvi immergere nell'universo di Rayman avendo un gameplay semplice con una difficoltà sulla norma

[b]VOTO: 8/10[/b]

Rayman origins... a decir verdad no comprendia por que han cambiado del 3d al 2d desde el ultimo rayman, pero terminaron sacando un plataformero bastante bueno y me ha sorprendido.
El diseño de niveles no es perfecto pero esta muy bien hecho y los secretos estan bien pensados.
Su aspecto visual es muy bonito, todo en este juego esta muy vivo y las criaturas son adorables :3
Aunque, el juego no es perfecto, tiene sus errores como por ejemplo cuando terminas un nivel te muestran tu puntuacion con una animacion (alta rima me hice), y no hubiera estado nada mal un boton para saltearla y tambien que algunos niveles  se me hicieron muy dificiles y otros mas faciles.
Y los bosses... los ves y dices WOW!! esto va a ser epico!! pero sus secuencias de ataques (en general) son muy lentas, aburridas y poco predecibles (con esto ultimo me refiero a que los ataques de estos son de prueba y error)

28866775.review:
I rarely write reviews unless the game is either amazing or just utter obnoxius shit. This game is not amazing. I like platformers and this is probably the worst I've played. I have to finish games so I couldn't stop playing but for the love of god it couldn't end fast enough.

Let me just get the stuff I liked out of the way. The animation and the artstyle, Done. 

Now onto the stuff I disliked. Gameplay. First problem I had was the goddamn level design punishes you for using sprint unless the level design wants you to use it. It would piss me off to no end to die just because I wasn't sure if I was supposed to sprint or not. It would be fine if it was clear when you are and aren't supposed to, but since your jump distance is never consistant it's nearly impossible to tell. It just becomes a trial and error for every timed jump in the entire game. Oh, i guess I wasn't supposed to sprint before jumping there. Then you get sent back to the very beginning of that level. 

This brings me to my second problem, the goddamn checkpoints. Oh man.  There were many, many times where a checkpoint should have been available, but there wouldn't be any, so there you go back to the start of really annoying sections running the damned things over and over until you do finally manage to  get through them.

Also, after every single level you have to sit through some obnoxious, repetitive scene that just tally's up your score for the level. I know 30 seconds may not sound like much, but you'll want to skip it after the first few times you see it. But you won't, because you can't. Have fun with that.

Overall, I did not enjoy the game one bit. Now I'm not even sure I want to play the next one, Rayman Legends, for fear of getting stuck having to beat it too.

If you want a great platformer just go buy Ori and the Blind Forest (Definitive Edition would probably work best) and play that instead. One of the my favorite games of all time.

Este juego es genial! Lo compre de rebajas hace un largo tiempo y la verdad no me arrepiento !

Este juego lo tiene todo para pasar un buen rato jugando con amigos, tu pareja, la familia..etc.

En el apartado de jugabilidad estamos ante un juego clasico, en dos dimensiones , pero no por ello es peor! Esta echo de una forma que de verdad requiere habilidad para pasar ciertos niveles y la coordinacion de movimientos sera clave! La verdad muy divertido conforme avanzas.
A nivel grafico estamos ante un muy buen acabado grafico, todo dibujado y escenarios realmente bonitos, entretenidos y visualmente agradables!
El sonido es sin duda la mejor faceta de este juego. Las melodias que podemos escuchar en distintos mapas y mundos es increible! Escucharas musica realmente divertida, de tension, epica...etc cada una en el momento adecuado del juego!

A nivel de horas de juego tiene para rato ! 24 horas lo he jugado yo, para completar la historia del juego y los secretos que tiene dentro!

26347797.review:
[h1]经典永不会被世间遗忘，因为总会有人记得它的[/h1]

[b]关于我和起源[/b]
我承认，我对雷曼系列的喜好是特别狂热的，要是它的系列出在steam上，我肯定优先购买它，管他的其他游戏。其中我感觉雷曼起源是整个系列当中，综合素质最好的，这也是为什么我把起源和传奇都入手了，传奇搞了700小小+游戏内全奖杯就放在库里不动了，起源却一直在玩下去，甚至现在都有可能正在拿起来玩。

雷曼起源是我在pc上玩的第一款雷曼系列游戏，这游戏对5年前的我来说……打开游戏的瞬间，那时的我惊讶到合不拢嘴。那时候我花了1个月的时间通关，半个月后通关青灰死地，可惜当时没有挑战自我，去收集全Lums奖牌和奖杯，于是它也就被搁置在我记忆4年了……

我知道了，对于那些既没有成就，也没有网络联机，也没有亢长的游戏主线流程（8小时以下？），更不是roguelike/lite或者 gal 的游戏，[b]挑战自我是通关后还能不断玩下去的最主要的动力，直到你彻底放弃它为止。[/b]

此外，启动游戏并不需要UPLAY，这样虽然没有了云存档，但至少不用承受那传说中让人诟病的土豆服务器了。

[h1]关于游戏关卡设计[/h1]

游戏是2d平台动作游戏就不用说了，但关卡设计我不得不说……

在单个关卡里，有Lums这个基础收集和“电子”（我叫它电子觉得不违和）这个重要收集要素。Lums在关卡里到处都有，有些比较危险或隐蔽的地方会有给25lums的金币。虽然大部分都可以轻松获得，但有些Lums难以找到或太危险。不过就算是要获得Lums奖牌也并不需要一关里全部收集齐，收集到350/200/150/100（视关卡为定）就可以收手通关了。

每个关卡都有6个或3个电子。以6个的关卡为标准，3个在笼子里找到，两个通过收集Lums（低于Lums奖牌），还有一个通过限时模式获得。如果正常打过关卡，能至少获取1个电子，但每次都这么通关是不可能通关整个游戏的，我在神奇的Raywiki查找了下，需求电子最多的主线关卡需要130个，也就是说：你至少要130个电子才能通关看到结局。

此外，除了上面所说的普通关卡外，还包含了：横版射击的蚊子关，Lums限定少但有强大敌人的boss关，以及纯跑酷的电子关和追箱子关等。

每个地区都有自己独特的内容：森林的藤蔓；沙漠它在天空上，还有那么多音乐有关的东西，会让老玩家想到雷1的音乐天；冰火区里拥有各种美食，而且冰和火的美食和当前主题一样，就怕你半夜爬起来玩饿了；海洋里可以遇见各种鱼类，而且在第一关还能见到海盗船呢~我分地区的大关为普通大关和高级大关：普通大关的最后你会骑着蚊子到达下一关，而高级大关的目的是打败四王，而且无需按照顺序打。在第一次进入Moody Clouds的Riding the Storm关卡会解锁全部的高级大关，不打败四王不能真正进入此关。

每个大关都有追箱子的关卡，完成了就可以获得一颗牙齿，这也是个重要收集要素。收集到10个解锁传说中的青灰死地，青灰死地虽然很难，但也比其他关卡更套路化，这个难度可以测试自己实力，不过要是明确的知道线路，通关会轻松很多。另外，我在视频网站看到了很多的一命通青灰死地视频，我再搞的话显得我很……大众化。况且我实力其实并不强，搞不出来一命通关的。


[h1]关于此游戏的难度以及和传奇的对比[/h1]

对于第一次接触这样的横版游戏的玩家来说，难度还是比较高的。但是这种难度还是可以玩下去的，不至于像一些成就质量高的横版那样，可怕到萌新几乎都跑掉了……
如果感觉无法驾驭，请在各大网站下载完美存档看一下结局就ok，或者右拐隔壁雷曼传奇：传奇不光难度降低了不只一点，还重置了起源的大部分关卡。（老实说，我真的不喜欢“回到起源”……）

[b]我认为起源和传奇的难度差距在于Lums的获取难度：[/b]
1，传奇有Lums链的COMBO，就是整个链的第一个Lums的分数x2，只要按照x2的Lums的放向正确获取可以确保整条链x2，轻松获得金杯，而且还有金币铺助；而起源只有那个限时分数x2的Lums king，不在限定时间内获得特别多的Lums就感觉亏了，这就导致起源上分困难，金币基本都要获得否则根本达不到限定分数，不熟悉地图想要得到Lums奖牌是不可能的；
2，传奇里的笼子不仅是收集品，还会给你加Lums，而且有8个……起源的笼子就是个收集品而已，也就在守护笼子的敌人有那么一点Lums。

[b]不过，有一点我可以肯定：[/b]
起源限时模式的难度比不上传奇限时关。起源限时模式的时间大多都很宽松，只要会速通操作，那奖杯就拿定了；但传奇不一样，传奇限时关的干扰因素实在是太多了，比如说darkray……传奇限时关想要40秒内赶到终点，只会操作是不行的，还要规划好最佳路线，把细节做好才行。

[b]还有一点必须说一下：[/b]传奇虽然公认比起源容易，但该难的地方还是难的不要不要的……比如说传奇最后一个boss，我打了整整10分钟，平均每20秒死一次；比如说传奇限时关，上面已经说了难在哪里；比如说每日/周关卡，感受到被真dalao支配的绝望吗？


[h1]关于速通操作和技巧[/h1]
虽然这栏目对普通玩家来说并没有用，也不适合所有人，但……谁叫我对雷曼起源那么偏执呢？

如果没有改键的话……s键攻击（以下按攻击键简称为“s”），按住shift奔跑，空格跳跃等，都是最基础的操作，不予置评
不过，普通玩家比较难以察觉到，这些看似简单的操作的深度……额我是说，这些操作特别具有延伸性，如果把这个给比我厉害的玩家，估计能玩出花样来2333
[list]
[*]先说个传奇玩家都知道的操作：在奔跑的时候s会有明显加速，在冰上等加速困难的地方，这操作尤为重要，而且在奔跑攻击中途跳会跳的更远。

[*]（然后的操作就不是谁都知道）
[*]翻滚攻击：在雷曼翻滚的时候s （如何翻滚，在落下或者奔跑攻击中按下键即可）虽然可以边打边走，但极其受地形的限制，一般都是在平地才施展这招。
[*]翻滚中和翻滚攻击后皆可以翻滚跳跃，而且会比平时跳的更高，跳的距离略小于奔跑攻击时跳跃，却比那个更有灵活性。
[*]有的时候，比起在空中攻击需要打才可以过去的东西，在空中直接往下砸更快一些：因为在空中往下砸，你雷在空中的时候也是有攻击判定的，而且砸到地面的瞬间奔跑攻击比空中攻击后落下还快那么几秒。
[*]小雷曼（就是变小之后）虽然不能奔跑攻击，却可以在空中按上+s进行上升攻击，用于快速上平台，不过也不是什么时候都能按上来的[spoiler]（也许是我键盘太老了，按键出了问题？）[/spoiler]
[/list]
虽然起源限时模式的时间大多充裕，但对于玩速通的玩家，[b]能快几秒就是几秒，哪怕一秒也是进步。[/b]希望能对你们有帮助，但普通玩家不必要过分的去追求极限。


[h1]关于画面以及音乐[/h1]

育碧在起源第一次使用了他们独家的ubiart引擎，效果嘛……从截图上就可以看出来，效果可是特别好的！

另外说一下：不管是我在这里讲的起源，还是后来居上的传奇和光之子，都能从截图中直接突出ubiart的厉害。[b]送这引擎100分，完全不怕你骄傲，甚至想再送一分。[/b]

精美的画面，精细的细节，流畅而毫无违和感的动作，让我觉得起源在当时可以算是艺术品级别。而且画风清新明亮，对于我这种喜欢明亮画风的玩家可以说是加分项。另外，手绘风格的选关界面，意外的和我口味，导致我经常就这么干看着大地图……


音乐对我来说是完美的，甚至以前就深入我心，曾经是我少数除音游外自愿开启声音的游戏（现在除了搞音乐游戏必须要开声音，其他时间都不会开声音……）。我到现在都还记得海洋关卡地图BGM里那个口哨，在现实中我还会跟着这个调子吹呢。

不过海洋关的BGM似乎出现反作用了，每次打海洋关，一听到那个bgm，那个尴尬症犯的啊……所以我现在打海洋关不是关BGM，就是直接把电脑声音关掉。但不代表海洋关bgm相对不好，只是我不是太喜欢而已。




[b]另外雷曼起源在去年12月正式被我题名为 “时间考验”奖 ，以此纪念我认定的经典~[/b]
不要看我游玩时间长，我在某网站查过了，比我游戏时间长的还有零星几个。在此评测发布之前还在逛了下视频网站发现，[url=https://tieba.baidu.com/p/2276889382]实际上这游戏的dalao还是挺多的，还个个比我强。[/url]

总的来说，雷曼起源是个良心的2D作品，不过估计大家都去买隔壁的传奇了……传奇虽然在各方面也很优秀，也是好游戏，但对于我来说，反而起源更好些

[h1]也许，传奇的各种设定符合大众口味，而起源，更适合喜欢挑战自己的玩家[/h1]

25962734.review:
Everything about Rayman Origins works.   Fastest review I've ever written.  I'm out people! 

Ok fine you're still here.  Rayman origins is a return to a very old character that never caught on like he should.   Personally I never played the original Rayman games, finding the character just too odd looking when next to Mario and Sonic. 

But fast forward about 15 years from then, and Rayman origins came around at a time when only indies made simple platforming games.   So is Ubisoft insane, or genius? 

Well I already said everything about this game works, so you figure it out.  But It really does.  You get the most amazing upbeat music in this game.  It creates a beautiful shiny world, and the world change at just the right pace.    The gameplay is tight, there's no life limit, and the player has a solid challenge with out being too harsh. 

I mean this game basically has revived my love of the 2d Platformer, a love that so many games have tried to ruin or tarnish since, but Rayman Origins (And the sequel legends) are as close to a perfect game.  There's challenge, but often times it's beyond just beating the level, rather to get some other goal.  It has a wonderful aesthetic.  I mean we're talking vibrant colors and music that are glorious compared to so many games that claim to have great graphics but just go for a dull look.  And then there's characters. 

As I mentioned before Rayman never caught on.  Actually, I don't know if I ever played as Rayman in a Rayman game, there's so many beautiful colorful creatures who run around, and allow the player to use them.  There's no gameplay benefit to any of the characters, so the player is free to pick the player that they wish. 

Speaking of different characters, the game also comes with a brilliant four player couch co-op multiplayer.  It's built on the drop in drop out so players can work together.  Now the player can accidently hit each other, knocking them in another direction which can cause death, but at the same time, to get revived, the player can fly around another and any attack or being jumped on will bring the player back. 

This system works perfectly.  If there's a coin or something for the player to try to grasp, the multiplayer allows the team to have multiple attempts.  There's no penalty for death, and the multiplayer really does work amazingly. 

I could spend hours raving about it.  There's only really two negatives I have for this game.  The first is achievements.  Or rather lack of them.  In fact the game doesn't implement steamworks at all.  No cloud save support, no achievements for beating the game, nothing.  This is a constant problem I have with Ubisoft's games.  Steam is a wonderful platform, but they have never fully supported it except for a scant few games. 

The other issue I'd bring up is the Damsel in distress problem.  Now first off I'm not going to claim this is game ruining, and this isn't a deal breaker.  In fact the game can even be said to be perfect, but when I play this game with the daughter, the fairies that the player have to chase and rescue are.. well over sexualized.  scantily clad, and they tend to be large breasted, long legs and "Sexified"

Here's the thing, So much of this game is kid friendly, I kind of wish the Faries could be more acceptable.  And while this doesn't ruin it, I look at the warrior princesses of Rayman Legends.   Those are brilliantly designed, and I'm glad that someone noticed this problem.  But it does deserve a negative mention, because it's one of the only things that is perfect for this game. 

Overall though, with that minor negative out of the way, I'm going to call this game perfect, which means as perfect as one can expect. at 20 bucks this game is great, at less, this game is an AMAZING value.  Rayman Origins produces a kid friendly, challenging platformer, that reminds the player more of a great NES while being as brilliantly colorful as almost any other game.   If you haven't given Rayman Origin's a shot, you should.  It's a fun engaging game, and really I can't ask for more.

25705972.review:
NOTE: This is a review of the game as played in local co-op with a friend and as such may not reflect the single-player experience properly.

This was fun! Rayman Origins is a fun platforming romp through colourful and imaginative worlds that resulted in far more laughs, giggles, chuckles and screams of "Nooo! Why did you punch me!? STOOOP IIIT!" -followed by even more laughing, than it ever has the right to.

For something so vehemetly old-fashioned and traditional, Rayman manages to encapsulate all the fun of old couch co-op platformers in a wonderfully modern little package that starts off easy and simple and builds up to a crescendo of challenge that might feel controller-throwingly annoying, if not for the presence of a friend to keep the game humorous and silly.

The music is great, the characters sound silly and the story, with all of its disco dancing and fairy panty-shots, is simple and funny enough to keep players of all ages chuckling and entertained from start to finish. And there is a TON of stuff for the completionists as well!

Well worth the price of admission!

Lokaler Co-Op/Multiplayer Review

Split Screen: Nein
Für wie viele Spieler: 4
Via Steam Link gespielt: Ja
Eingabegerät: xBox 360 Pads
Modi: Co-Op

Co-Op: Man kann das ganze Spiel mit bis zu vier Personen durchspielen. Dabei kann sich jeder einen Charakter aud dem Rayman Universum aussuchen und man spielt auch immer weitere frei und kann diese immer wieder wechseln. 

Fazit: Die Rayman Serie gehört wohl zu den besten Jump'n'Runs auf dem PC und das Spiel mit Freunden durchzuspielen macht auf jeden Fall Laune, auch wenn es etwas chaotisch ist. Auf jeden Fall hat man so etwas zu lachen. Wir haben es zu dritt gespielt und haben es nicht gleich wieder ausgemacht, was bei miesen Games immer sehr schnell passiert. Dazu kommt, dass Rayman auch an sich ein tolles und liebesvolles Game voller Details ist so dass man es auch alleine gut spielen kann. 

Alternativen: Trine Serie (Aber nur für 3 Spieler), Rayman Legends

25452593.review:
[h1]Assa Reviews:
Un comentario diciendo porque te ha sido útil o porque no antes de valorar se agradece bastante.[/h1]

El primer videojuego de Rayman que juego, no tuve la oportunidad de probar los primeros juegos de 64 o ps1, siempre leí cosas buenas de esta franquicia, así que decide comenzar a jugar el primer videojuego de Rayman en 2D.

Rayman Origins es un plataformas por excelencia, la jugabilidad y las mecánicas son simples pero aportan mucho a la hora de jugar, hay niveles en los cuales tienes que ser muy preciso al apretar un botón, ni fuerte, ni despacio, preciso, los poderes ayudan mucho a conseguir diferentes: secretos, monedas etc, cada uno de ellos tiene una función especifica que te ayudara a pasar cierto nivel, si bien es cierto que hay uno en especial que puedes optar por no usar en todo el juego (Cargar el puño), no afecta en nada a la experiencia del juego.

El nivel artístico del juego tanto en gráficas, escenarios, ambientación es espectacular, cada mundo cuenta con niveles distintos y llenos de vida: bosque, mar, hielo, fuego, etc.
El soundtrack del juego otra de esas cosas que resaltan por si solas, la composición y los ritmos de los distintos niveles son simples, graciosas, pero quedan perfectamente con el estilo de Rayman y hace que la atmosfera del juego sea mucho más relajante, hay algunos niveles que sobresalen en cuando a su "música" lo cual es brutal.

El juego cuenta con 10 mundos + 1 secreto, en los cuales tienen 5 a 6 niveles en cada uno, el juego es muy sencillo, pero el reto está en conseguir todos los lumns en los niveles y los time challenges lo cual tampoco es que sea hardcore pero si hay unos cuantos que te costaran algunos intentos extra, pero nada imposible.

El modo coop de 4 jugadores es realmente espectacular, es muy difícil reunir a 4 amigos a jugar en tu casa, pero si logras hacerlo pasaras unos momentos divertidísimos, riendo e insultando a tus bros, una experiencia única que pocos juegos logran hacer y uno de plataforma menos.

Sé que muchos pueden comparar el juego con otros grandes juegos del género como el Mario o Donkey Kong, pero yo creo que cada uno tiene lo suyo y resalta en algo, Rayman tiene esa increíble atmosfera de querer explorar cada escenario mientras disfrutamos de su arte y música, tampoco pueden ponerse a comparar el juego con sus antiguos predecesores en 3D, ya que es muy absurdo, son géneros distintos es como comparar el clásico Mario con el Mario galaxy o el 3D World cada uno tiene lo suyo y son totalmente distintos.

Si eres amante de los juegos en plataformas 2D y aun no tuviste la oportunidad de probar Rayman Origins pues no tienes excusa para probarlo ahora que lo regalaron en la plataforma de Uplay, hazlo te encantara.

[code]http://store.steampowered.com/app/207490/[/code]

25428442.review:
Rayman Origins is the first installment,  followed by Rayman Legends. Back in 2012 I owned this game on my Wii and enjoyed the multiplayer hard with some buddies, resulting in fun and destroyed Friendships (well not really of course).

This game covers overall 5 diffirent worlds, some in a jammy desert while others are in a temple full of buddism. Yeah, the placement for these are pretty unique, however some levels feel quite repetitive, which you will eventually notice when doing the time trials. Time trials give you a time set, which you need to beat with touching the red flag further in the level. They are quite fair and even some inexperienced players should be able to get at least the normal time done.

Movement feels good even though compared to Rayman Legends, kicks in the air stop you down completly, by standing on a broken platform you have to jump first and then slam down and so on. It was the first game however, and a pretty good job was done for that. Even by using some tricks you get to be faster than actually possible set.

Eventually by proceeding through the levels and saving these little pink fluffly balls, you get to unlock a treasure chase. High movement is required while chasing an eyed-chest, funky music too. It contains a red gem that acts like a teeth for that grandpa over at the Snoring tree. Collect 10 and you enter the land of the Undead, which have been triggered by loud noises at the start. 

Rayman does many things right, what it fails at compeltly is the trial and error. Mostly in bosses, but just it's all about remembering the whole fight. 

8/10

24620567.review:
Die Wiederbelebung des Klassikers,

ich habe Rayman Origins in Zeiten meines Plattformermangels gekauft und wurde nicht enttäuscht. Rayman Origins hat ein zauberhaftes Artdesign, einen guten Flow, wenn man nicht gerade dabei ist, alle Lumen einzusammeln, eine stimmige Musik und symphatische Charaktere. 

Kurze Zusammenfassung:

Spielweise/Mehrspieler

Rayman spielt sich wie jeder anderer Plattformer. Man hüpft, fliegt, rast, schwimmt und boxt sich durch die bunten Levels der Raymanwelt. 

Es gibt einen Mehrspielermodus, der mich als ehrgeiziger Alles-Sammler und Beste-Zeit-Holer nicht so begeistern konnte, da mein(e) Mitspieler eher herumtrollen wollten, was man ja auch sehr gut in diesem Spiel machen konnten. Also für jene, die nicht so Arcade-fokussiert sind, können hier mit ihren Freunden sehr viel Spass haben. Die Animationen der einzelnen Helden sind sehr lustig dabei anzusehen, wenn man einander durch die Gegend prügelt, aber auch ab und zu das Leben rettet, wenn der Mitstreiter in einer Blase durch die Gegend fliegt. 
Zusammen kann man natürlich die schwerer erreichbaren Punkte leichter erreichen, man kann Leitern bilden, aber auch Ketten und aneinanderhangelnd sich gegenseitig vor dem Tod retten.

Welt/Leveldesign:

Die Welten sind charakteristisch, die Gegner kreativ ein Lächeln hervorholend, die Endgegner teilweise knackig.
Die Levels sind wie die Oberwelt in einem schönen Comic-Look gehalten. Vom Dschungel mit seinen Looping-Wasserfällen über die musikalischen Wolken und ihren perplexen Vogelbewohner hin durch die heißen Tiefen von Suppendinosauriern. 
Rayman Origins hier absolut genial Vielfalt.

Sound
Kurz: Einmal schwimmen gehen und die Lumen singen hören. Ab dann möchte man nicht mehr aus dem Wasser. Und dabei mag ich keine Wasserlevels.

Fazit
Kaufen und wenn man noch Geld hat, Rayman Legends kaufen, denn Legends ist sogar noch besser.

Rayman: Origins is the kind of reimagining that would put the occasional reboot like Thi4f to shame. While it stays close to the concept of the original 1997 release, newcomers will most certainly enjoy it as well. If you're into extensive use of colors, floaty controls compared to games like Super Meat Boy and Limbo, and good old-fashioned boss fights, then Origins isn't exactly your worst bet.

Also, I recommend that you buy this game before you've completed the Back to Origins levels in Rayman: Legends, in case you already possess it, since some genius thought it would be nice to insert half of Origins into Legends as extra content. Well, it was pretty nice, but kind of a shame when you're playing this game and going through levels you've already gone through. Kinda ruins the surprise.

22634224.review:
(Si parece que he jugado poco tiempo es ya me lo pasé en la Wii, ni siquiera sé si volveré a completarlo)
Rayman 2 y 3 son los mejores plataformas que han existido jamás, o lo serían si no existiese Super Mario Galaxy.
Rayman tiene ese toque que le falta a Super Mario en el 99% de juegos de sus saga, y es la sensación de que estás haciendo esto por algo, que estás viviendo una aventura.
Los juegos de Mario se esfuerzan (O a mi me lo parece) por crear historias muy olvidables, basados siempre en la típica historia de la damisela en apuros (Error corregido en Mario &: Luigi Super Star Saga), mientras que su ``otro´´ rival, exceptuando su primera entrega te pone en un mundo bastante más oscuro de lo que es normal ver en este género, e incluso se esforzaban en crear una atmósfera única y fascinante.
Pero bueno, aquí toca hablar de este curioso reboot que de Rayman sólo tiene a los personajes, no hay nada de lo que he dicho anteriormente.
Ya sabéis, hay que recoger a los lums que están enjaulados porque alguien tiene que hacerlo, también podría hablar de su apartado visual, que es simplemente sublime, como era de esperar del motor Ubiart.
Por otro lado,, esto es básicamente Super Mario 64 en 2D, sólo que aquí en vez de buscar estrellas buscamos lums.
Esto no tendría por qué ser un problema, pero lo és porque no sólo la razón para buscar lums es muy típica y aburrida, que, repito, no tiene porque ser algo malo si al menos la excusa sirviera para dar lugar a niveles inolvidables como en Super Mario 64.
Pero no, aquí hay varios niveles bastante parecidos entre ellos y el humor se vuelve cada vez más repetitivo y cansino, te ves haciendo las mismas cosas todo el rato, y me da muchísima rabia que no estén esos juegos clásicos en Steam, porque los compraría sin dudar.
Donde Rayman 3 se inventaba un nivel en el que te enfrentabas a un francotoridar en plan The End de Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, donde en Rayman 2 te tocaba decidir si elegir salvar a tu amigo o hacerte rico (Con un final alternativo hilarante en caso de escoger la segunda opción) aquí... superamos un nivel, tras otro, tras otro, tras otro y jefe final.
Se acabo el juego, me olvidaré de él.

22510812.review:
雷曼起源，是一款画风可爱，节奏明快的2D横版过关游戏，虽然是育碧出品，但却不需要UPlay平台，这一点和雷曼传奇不同。

特别提醒：在雷曼传奇中，收录了本作的40个经典关卡，并根据雷曼传奇的艺术风格进行了全新的重制，还可以使用在雷曼传奇中解锁的人物。前提是需要先完成雷曼传奇的部分关卡，并在过关评价中拿到刮刮乐奖励，刮刮乐有一定几率解锁重制关卡，全部解锁需要一定时间。

操作方面，本作和雷曼传奇大体相同，但本作的难度要更高一些。这是因为：本作普通关的过关评价中，除了需要找到全部的伙伴并解救之外，还要收集一定数量的光之精灵，以及在一定时间内完成关卡。这两项数据在不同的关卡中会有所变化，根据关卡长度而定。操作失误只能重新开始整个关卡，而不能选择从上个存档点开始。另外，本作的操作手感也不如雷曼传奇流畅。

收集一定数量的光之精灵，意味着每个骷髅金币都不能错过，同时，气泡内的物品会在几秒钟内消失，如果反应速度慢，也会达不到数量要求。一定时间内完成关卡，意味着不能死亡，最速到达终点。只有收集足够的笑脸，才能解锁后面的关卡。宝箱关的过关奖励是红色骷髅牙齿，集齐10个才能解锁终极关卡：青灰死地。过于苛刻的解锁关卡要求，一定程度上降低了游戏乐趣，也增加了通关难度，手残玩家请谨慎购买。

游戏可以本地合作，互助过关或是彼此陷害，最多支持4人。除了常规关卡之外，还有跑酷类关卡、弹幕类关卡和BOSS战关卡等等。

相比之下，还是建议玩雷曼传奇中的追溯起源重制关卡，虽然不是全部，但精华都在，而且经过重制以后，游戏体验更好。但本作同样是一款优秀的游戏，这一点无可否认。

如果实在想玩本作，又不愿意花费大量时间和精力反复刷同一个关卡拿笑脸，建议去网上下载一个完美存档，亲测正版可用，两全其美。

Un malgasto de dinero.
Controles correctos, pero una jugabilidad mediocre (la habilidad de cargar el puño es inútil e innecesaria en todo el juego), diversas hitbox imprecisas, y lo peor, un diseño de niveles pobre y repetitivo a más no poder. Se ve el esfuerzo y ganas de crear algo, pero cada nivel en cada mundo es igual al anterior con pocas variantes. Muy muy repetitivo y soso, ni siquiera el nivel final se salva. Hasta los jefes son simplones y aburridos, no te ponen a prueba en absoluto, salvo uno del que tienes que huir. Ni siquiera es rejugable, algo extraño dado su género.

Lo único positivo que veo son algunos niveles de agua (sorprendentemente), el estilo visual y la música, que es pegadiza pero incluso llega a ser pesada en ocasiones. 

Un juego que quiere que te rías con él pero se pasa de pedante y cansa. No lo recomiendo a menos que quieras un plataformas sencillo y que requiera poco de ti, sino hay muchas optativas mejores e interesantes.

21412643.review:
Rayman Origins, un jeu qui a fait l'unanimité (ou presque). J'ai donc décidé de me lancer dans l'aventure, moi qui ignore tout du jeu de plateforme. Le résultat? J'ai trouvé ça très ennuyeux. 

Je ne saurais pas dire si c'est à cause des jeux de plateforme en général (auxquels je ne me suis essayé qu'à de rares occasions) ou si c'est à cause du jeu en lui-même, mais au bout de deux trois niveaux j'en avais déjà marre. J'ai tenté de m'y replonger plusieurs fois mais sans grand succès. Je ne nie pas ses qualités graphiques, bien que la direction artistique ne me plait pas trop, il y a d'excellentes idées, une foultitude de costumes à débloquer, le nombre de niveaux qui a l'air assez conséquent et la bande-son est de très bonne facture, mais je trouve que ça manque de quelque chose, j'ai le plus grand mal  à m'y intéresser réellement. Sans compter la reconnaissance de la manette de 360, une véritable purge ne serait-ce que pour remapper les boutons. 

Malgré tout, je pense tester d'autres jeux de plateforme pour voir si c'est ce jeu en particulier que je trouve peu intéressant ou si je devrais retourner sur Dark Souls ou Planescape et laisser les plateformers aux speedrunners. J'avais pu m'essayer à un niveau musical de Rayman Legend, et c'était très fun, peut-être commencerai-je par celui-là? 

En définitive, je ne conseille ce jeu que si vous adhérez aux plateformers, mais ne vous attendez pas à la bombe annoncée, je pensais jouer à quelque chose de génial et j'en ressors plutôt déçu.

21358943.review:
雷曼的作品只玩过雷曼起源和雷曼传奇，所以仅对这两部作品进行比较和评价。
整体而言，个人喜欢起源多过传奇。
难度
传奇的难点基本集中在了限时关卡和青灰死地，然而限时关卡的难度并不在于你的操作而是在于你是否能够找到最短最快的捷径，所以基本死多几次也就摸得一清二楚了；而青灰死地则是背板背板再背板，更何况之前的关卡里就有标准答案，跟着音乐和莱姆走基本就能过去了。然而起源，天啊，简直不堪回首！从第二关的沙漠关起，就疯狂受苦——各种死各种考验操作。尤其是最后的青灰死地，真的是打得我整个人都不好了。印象最深的是倒数第二节喷火那里，我以为是会自动变小的，结果疯狂地死，我尝试了各种办法然并卵，甚至以为出了bug重新打了两遍前面的关卡。后来我去看了下视频，才顿悟到那里要下蹲、蹲...当时整个人都斯巴达了！当然不能忘了让很多人又爱又恨的箱子关...个人在倒数第二的深海箱子关已经死了无数遍...起源要拿奖牌真心很难，倒是传奇拿金杯还是蛮容易的。
关卡设计
讲道理，个人觉得传奇更多地添加了些解密的色彩，比如有些关卡就不是线性的了，而且一些蓝小小的位置藏那叫一个狡猾...而起源主要考验的是玩家的操作能否一气呵成——如果中途有失误的话，往往会错过很多东西。
场景方面，传奇和起源都做得非常漂亮；然而还是起源略胜一筹。之所以这样说，传奇的单个大关风格基本没有太大的变化，而起源则会有令人赞叹不已的场景变化。比如：饕餮之地的冰火变化、深海关从浅海到深海的变化，衔接都做得非常自然美丽。虽然传奇里的深海关貌似是在一艘破船和海底之城里进行的，但是让我想起了生化奇兵，个人也是非常喜欢的。
操作
我想吐槽雷曼的操作很久了...雷曼的判定有时真的很迷。我明明摁的是小跳，但是结果出来的是大跳——就因为这个我在深海箱子关的那两个连续小跳死了无数次...然后我非常想吐槽传奇里那只该死的青蛙！那个在起源里死太多次问你要不要放弃的那只酱油青蛙，在传奇里莫名地成了重要的角色！大部分时间没有它还不行！还要按Y键！天啊你能想象在摁着加速的时候既要A又要X还要Y的场景吗？！我已经不知道被这该死的青蛙坑了多少次！每次都让我手忙脚乱、左右互搏、A、X、Y傻傻分不清...我真的不懂育碧在想什么。
音乐
两作的音乐都做得非常棒，非常切合各个关卡的氛围。饕餮之地的墨西哥风、深海空灵悠扬的音乐、青灰死地的激昂...说道音乐，不得不提传奇里设计的最棒的ROCK关卡——基本就是听音乐用的，没有什么难度。所有的音乐都太好听了，而且风格各异，每次我开雷曼的时候都要先过一遍音乐关。
最后，起源不需要UPLAY平台，传奇要。光这点起源就可以怒甩传奇两条街了...
总而言之，个人觉得起源更为核心向，传奇更加欢乐，各位想玩雷曼的，可以各取所需。个人推荐是先走起源，再打传奇，然后你就会有种从地狱到天堂的感觉。

21183487.review:
Le jeu souffre de nombreux problèmes au niveau du game design qui le rendent furstrant marlgrès une réalisation vraiment superbe. Et c'est dommage, même si l'experience globale est agréable.

Tout d'abord les sprites même s'ils sont magnifique souffrent de problèmes de hitbox, nottement sur les objets en pointe qui touchent généralement bien plus loins que ce qu'ils n'affichent, certains ennemis aussi sont très déroutants au début du jeu car peu intuitif dans la façon dont ils touchent ou non. Mais ça, c'est juste du détail et on fini par s'y habituer.

Non le réel problème du jeu c'est que son gameplay est imprécis. Et que même si graphiquement il est incroyable, le level design est parfois terriblement.. Nul. Le jeu n'est pas pensé pour l'optimisation, ce qui à mon sens est inconcevable pour un jeu de plateforme, le meilleur exemple ce sont les niveaux à scrolling (ceux pour récupérer les dents par exemple) où on se retrouve à un problème terrible : On va trop vite pour le jeu. Et quand on ratrapppe le scrolling, je ne sais pas si le jeu bug ou quelque chose du genre, mais il nous replace automatiquement pour qu'on suive les tracés préenregirstré par le jeu, c'est juste insensé.. Du coup on se retrouve à devoir marcher et s'arrêter dans des niveaux où la tématique est "Allez le plus vite possible pour ratrapper un ennemi qui cours trop vite pour vous" si on atteint pas ici le summum du paradoxe.. Et de façon globale on voit bien que le jeu est pensé pour être joué mal. J'ai eu tout au long de l'aventure le sentiment de devoir faire exprès de mal jouer pour ne pas être victime d'un bug de collision ou d'un repositionement defectueux du jeu. Ça se ressent aussi par le fait que le jeu est globalement très simple. On met facilement 20 secondes aux temps records lors des time attack pour avoir la coupe. Les zones secrètes ne sont très souvent pas du tout cachées, il n'y a réellement que la zone du jeu qu'on débloque après avoir récupéré toutes les dents qui est agréable à jouer. 

J'ai l'impression de passer pour un joueur élitisite en écrivant ce message, ce qui je reproche à Rayman Origins ce n'est pas tant qu'il soit destiné à un public de joueurs novices en terme de plateformers, mais qu'il ne laisse pas la possibilité à ceux qui ont envie de tryhard de le faire.. Et c'est frustrant par ce que le jeu est magnifique, les annimations sont géniales et la BO est fantastique, c'est ça qui m'a rendu fou dans ce jeu, j'ai eu constamment l'impression que ce Rayman était à deux doigts d'être génial.. 

En conclusion, si vous êtes un novice en terme de jeux de plateforme vous passerez certainement un bon moment, le jeu est designé pour donner le sentiment qu'on acomplis des choses extraordinaires en marchant tout droit, mais si vous adorez les platformers hardcore et les die&retry par exemple, vous allez surement vivre la même frustration que moi.

I like this game. Sadly, the game is meant for kids below the ages of 12. This is not a negative per se but I find that I am unable to appreciate the prepubescent cuteness. I loved the idea of the extra levels, each level is revisited again to find the King of the land. However, I would call this a non-priority game. Why? There is no excitement that constantly makes me want to keep on playing. I use this more as a filler game when I'm free.

PROS
1. Hidden Levels
Lots of them to find. They aren't hard to find but it's worth looking for.

2. Mini Games
The mosquito level was very interesting. Being able to fly a mosquito with a vacuum proboscis was fun.

3. Pig Latin
I didn't see it at first, but then I saw that the language used was Pig Latin or Ig-Pay Atin-Lay.

4. Revisiting
It's nice to see that they place another set of levels on top of the original set, so you basically get 2 separate copies of the same zone. 1 easy mode and 1 hard mode.

CONS
1. Hard to keep my attention for long
I don't know how to put it, I wanted to play the game a bit at a time.

2. Hard to Keep Interested
Unlike other games, I seem to only want to complete this game at a really slow pace. Like 1 stage per day.

19636310.review:
I've had Rayman Origins on the PlayStation 3 since it first came out, and it's given me hardly any disappointment. It's a fantastically fun game!

There's no need to complain about the lack of a story simply because this game is emulating the good ol' days where it was just about the gameplay and fun and not necessarily about the story.

Rayman Origins is a 2D platformer, and the control in this game is very smooth and responsive. The game boasts 60+ levels of awesomeness, and players get new powers from the nymphs as they go along. Yes, you have to win the power of punching and kicking. But that's a callback to the first game! And the third! The levels are differently themed. You will travel through jungles, oceans, mountains, frozen tundras, musical lands and even an infernal kitchen! The game is designed to be relatively easier to just get through, however the game does get a lot harder as you progress. Plus, the major challenge in the game comes from gathering the collectables. Electoons can be found in cages or won by collecting hundreds of Lums, which can be found scattered throughout the level, obtained from defeating enemies or finding Skull Coins. The Tricky Treasure levels provide the second-biggest challenge in the game, as they are frantic chase-the-chest levels where the stage pretty much falls apart even worse as you keep going, and you earn Skull Teeth from these. The boss fights are not as difficult as I expected them to be, but they still provide a good challenge. However, once you complete the game there are a few very interesting twists that I will not reveal. Play the game to find out. :P The hardest challenge, of course, comes from The Land of the Livid Dead, a level that is unlocked after gathering all 10 Skull Teeth.
[EDIT: I have played this level, and GOSH DARN IT is it hard! I lost track of how many times I died just trying to complete one section of the stage, but it's a lot of fun, and worth it, too. :) ]

But it all gets a lot zanier and crazier if you bring some buddies along! Up to four players can play this game at the same time. I've only done co-op with one friend at a time (I only had 2 PS3 controllers), but even that gets nutsy after a little while. The players have free reign to slap each other without directly hurting each other (however that won't stop you from accidentally launching your buddy off the cliff or into a trap). I have, however, done a whole bunch of friend co-op in the game's sequel, Rayman Legends, and if that mayhem was any indication, you're gonna have a great time with this one!

The Windows/OS X port was done pretty well. The only gripe I have is that it doesn't appear to be optimized TOO well, as occasionally it will skip a frame or two. It's nothing terrible, but to me, it's noticeable.

Now, people may want to draw parallels to Legends. Is it better? Well... To be honest, I found Legends to be a little too easy. Origins packs more of a challenge from what I could see, and, honestly, I kinda prefer the cartoony art over the more realistic rendering of Legends. And it had an anti-climatic ending that wasn't funny like this on--
In fact, screw it. This game is miles better than Rayman Legends. To be fair, Legends has more content, but something just feels...off about that game compared to this one. This game has lots of character, bright environments, upbeat and fantastic music and, well, the entire game is amazing!

If you love platformers and/or Rayman, GET THIS GAME. You will NOT be disappointed! As you can see, I had no problem buying another copy of this game, so even if you have this game on a console already, get it for Steam.

19288278.review:
[h1]L’atmosfera partorita da Michel Ancel è decisamente calda e divertente: humour scanzonato e  level design eccezionale [/h1]

Siete pronti ad un viaggio ricco di locations da scoprire, colori da assaporare, personaggi dalle bizzarre e allegre forme da conoscere, ma soprattutto emozioni assopite da risvegliare? Giù nell’oceano, su a bordo di simpatici insetti, in mezzo ai deserti, e poi fra nivee cupole…

[b]Storia:[/b] in un tempo lontano, lontano, ma in uno spazio meno vago: la Radura dei Sogni, più precisamente all’ombra dell’Albero Sbadigliante sonnecchiano beatamente i nostri 4 eroi. Il loro sonno è tanto profondo quanto lo è il loro russare, che irrimediabilmente finisce col giungere beffardo alla funesta Terra dei Morti Lividi; destando la tranquillità dei Darktoon, figure partorite dagli incubi del Sognabolle. Costoro, percepito il fragoroso “brusio” come un’affronto indicibile, pensano bene di ripagare cotanta sfrontatezza con un’invasione su vasta scala. 
Ecco che Rayman & Co. saranno chiamati a liberare i 5 Mondi…

[b]Gameplay:[/b] 3 azioni base: attacco, corsa, e salto. Il resto lo fa la l’interazione con lo stage dove imparare i tricks legati ai salti, studiando via via i livelli. L’inizio è lento e semplice, per cominciare a tastare il cuore nevralgico del titolo Ubisoft: la sincronia dei movimenti del nostro personaggio interagendo con nemici e scenario; apprendendo il ritmo, la velocità, i tempi di reazione.
Nuove abilità, tramite le ninfe, le apprenderemo col proseguo, come la planata, il ridimensionamento (alla Alice), la possibilità di camminare sui muri, ecc…
Per procedere dovremo liberare gli electoons. Uno è ottenuto sempre completando lo stage, ma altri li sbloccheremo con i Lum, da collezionare attraverso l’esplorazione; se sarete particolarmente bravi, otterrete anche la medaglia. Se incontrate il Lum di stazza maggiore, potrete contare su un bonus temporaneo che vi garantirà un conteggio raddoppiato degli esserini fluorescenti: in tal caso bisognerà seguire un percorso pre-stabilito per massimizzare il bonus; una breve sezione che ricorda gli anelli di Sonic.
E’ possibile affrontare l’avventura con altri personaggi, ma le skills rimangono identiche, la variante è meramente estetica.
I livelli sono più profondi di ciò che lasciano intendere ad una prima occhiata, mostrano percorsi alternativi a chi avrà l’ardire di osare, magari in una run successiva.
Ogni tanto il titolo muterà genere svestendo i panni di platform, per indossare quello di una sorta di shooter orizzontale alla Sine Mora, meno complesso ovviamente.
Completano il quadro i denti da collezionare e le aree segrete da scoprire.

[b]IA:[/b] la difficoltà base non è tarata verso l’alto, come in Giana Sisters, anche se è fondamentale la coordinazione occhio-dita (meglio usare il pad per limitare eventualmente il lag) e il tempismo per non ripartire dal checkpoint precedente. Infatti ogni livello, di ogni mondo, è disseminato di questi punti intermedi -ripercorribili quante volte si vorrà, senza limiti- ma manca la possibilità del classico game-over. 
Se si perde non si riparte dal primo livello: una scelta -simile a quella messa in essere con Metal Slug X- che mira ad allargare il target anche verso un pubblico casual. Ciò non toglie che comunque il titolo sappia dare soddisfazioni sia in fasi avanzate con ostacoli infidi; sia più specificamente ai più smaliziati giocatori che abbracceranno lo spirito competitivo insito nel ottenere il punteggio migliore possibile con annesse medaglie, zone segrete, e run a tempo in cui inseguire dei forzieri. 
Forse sarebbe stato ancora più interessante avere un approccio più impegnativo cadenzato da un numero limitato di “vite”, come i classici cuoricini usati nell’angolo in alto dello schermo da bei cabinati di una volta. Restano per fortuna le sezioni Boss Fght più impegnative, da sbloccare recuperando molti più electoons di quelli necessari a portare semplicemente a termine l’avventura.

Co-op locale fino a 4 giocatori è caratterizzata dal drop -in/drop-out. In realtà 4 elementi potrebbero creare della confusione soprattutto se non affiatati, anche perché si può colpire il compagno d’avventura; ma in 2 ci si può divertire molto. Ogni personaggio mantiene il personale numero di collezionabili; se termina la “salute” viene ingabbiato in una bolla che un altro giocatore dovrà bucare per riportarlo in “vita”.

[b]Comparto grafico:[/b] i diversificati Mondi di gioco brillano di luce propria, mostrando vivacità e allegria da vendere; lo stile dei personaggi a mò di cartoon, mostra carattere e personalità. E’ come tuffarsi in un’epoca dal sapore antico ma dalle pennellate moderne. La paletta cromatica è densa di timbri saturi, con una ricerca di accostamenti sempre incisiva.

[b]Comparto tecnico:[/b] il titolo mosso dall’UbiArt Framework ci mostra animazioni strambe che non lesinano genuine risate. Il frame-rate è granitico ed esulta l’incedere veloce.

[b]Comparto audio:[/b] un altro aspetto eccellente. Siamo dinanzi ad un tripudio di temi musicali che prendono vita dalla flora e dalla fauna stessa degli scenari. Siamo spettatori ed interpreti allo stesso tempo di un'orchestra, che non dirigiamo direttamente, ma di cui facciamo parte rendendo il Mondo ancora più vivo, ancora più partecipativo.

[b]Commento finale:[/b] un titolo che tenta di mettere d'accordo più utenze differenti. Le sezioni più complesse da sbloccare aggiungono quel pepe di sfida in più tipico del genere platform 2D. A stupire è l’interazione col mondo di gioco, con cui i più smaliziati s’impegneranno in serie di tricks per un’esplorazione profonda e densa di soddisfazioni.

19267509.review:
[h1][b]LES PLUS[/b][/h1]
[list][*]Le moteur du jeu offre une réelle identité au titre. Que ce soit les personnages et monstres ou les éléments du décors, tout est réalisé à la main. Les animation sont très cartoonesque, tout comme l'ambiance du jeu. Si le biome de la jungle est quelque peu inspiré, on craque devant ceux du désert, de la montagne, des profondeurs sous-marine ou de la banquise ! Le tout est réellement fluide, et rend Rayman Origins réellement agréable à parcourir.
[*]La bande son est également une pure merveille. Explorant plusieurs ambiances, qu'elles soient festives, épiques, pleine de tension ou lorgnant du côté des films d'espionnage, on se surprendra à ne plus avancer pour profiter de ce bonheur auditif. Les bruitages sont un peu en deçà, mais on pardonne aisément Ubisoft !
[*]Du challenge, vous en aurez ! une difficulté bien dosée, loin d'être gratuite et qui croit continuellement. On aura parfois des moments de rage et s'il est vrai que le jeu ne pourra pas être fini par tous et toutes, il faut avouer que cette sensation d'apprentissage et de progression fait un bien fou. Compléter le jeu dans sa totalité demandera du temps et donc de la patience. Néanmoins l'aventure principale se suffit largement à elle seule.
[*]Rayman Origins possède un excellent level design. Que ce soit en terme d'obtention progressive des différents pouvoirs, des cachettes d'objets à collecter, des salles secrètes ou tout simplement de la traversée des niveaux, rien ne semble trop classique ou trop répétitif. Le titre se réinvente à chaque monde, nous menant avec entrain et découverte sans peine jusqu'à la fin du jeu. La durée de vie quant à elle est très respectable avec environs dix heures de jeu en ligne droite. 
[*]La coopération offre des parties complètement délirantes entre amis. La gestion de l'écran est bien maîtrisée, et si l'entraide et de mise, mettre quelques baffes à son collègue n'a jamais fait de mal à personne ! La coopération rend le jeu plus facile, mais également beaucoup plus drôle.[/list]

[h1][b]LES MOINS[/b][/h1]
[list][*]Quelques bugs pouvant détruire la sauvegarde ou nécessitant un redémarrage du jeu. Si les premiers sont rares, les seconds se montrent irritants, à l'image d'un Ubisoft qui continue de faire des portages moyennement soignés sur PC.
[*]Alors que le jeu dispose d'un niveau assez relevé, on ne peut pas en dire de même des boss. D'une facilité déconcertante, on ressort déçu de chaque affrontement pourtant très attendu. Dommage, car leur design est assez chouette.
[*]La cinématique d'introduction mal compressée donne parfois une bouillie de pixels... mais qu'importe, elle reste anecdotique -un intérêt musical y réside tout de même- et l'intérêt du jeu est ailleurs ![/list]

[h1][b]CONCLUSION[/b][/h1]
[quote]Vous l'aurez compris : Rayman Origins est un jeu de plateforme 2D incroyable, beau et agréable pour les oreilles. Certainement un des meilleurs de sa catégorie, aux côtés de titres comme Mario ou quelques rares Sonic. La mascotte sans bras, ni cou, ni jambes a réussi le pari de revenir en force à travers un titre plus modeste que ce à quoi Ubisoft nous habitue avec ses triple A. On a beau chercher, on ne lui trouve que peu de défauts. Des boss trop faciles et un portage PC pas exempt de faiblesse empêchent une note parfaite, mais il s'agit là d'un véritable coup de cœur à faire ou à refaire en solitaire ou avec une bande de copains ! 9 sur 10.[/quote]

18127253.review:
A really nice action platformer with gorgeous 2D visuals depicting interesting and creative themes, solid controls and a gameplay that, while based on the first rayman from the PS1 era, is a lot more refined and fast paced, with great flow and bringing concepts from other modern games in the genre. 

The painting-like maps and characters look like moving, playable concept art, with an enormous amount of layers, effects and animated elements. Some areas are more detailed than others, the first being one of the best, but even the simpler ones still give an amazing feel.

The music stands out with some really catchy tunes, but in a number of instances focuses a lot on childish sounds and themes that may become irritating to some people after a while.

The story, at least the part told directly in the form of cutscenes and dialogue during gameplay, is extremely simplistic, childish and minimalist, but hides lots of details and connections to earlier games in the franchise for whoever decides to look for extra material on the internet.

I felt a few pacing problems around the 60-80% mark, where the game was starting to feel longer than it should be, but after that it got me glued again until I finished it.

Highly recommended!

17950643.review:
A great 2D platformer, capturing the original Rayman style with some of the elements from Rayman 2, 3, etc. The characters are quite creative and humorous, the music is nicely orchestrated and occassionally silly, and the environments are fun to explore around and find hidden coins and areas. 

What kills this game is it's difficulty. At times, there are levels that are too intense, and that's due to either the areas getting too dangerous and cramped for you to dodge and jump, a lot of enemies and obstacles getting too crowded, or everything at a fast pace. This makes it even harder in cases like the boss levels, as you try to remember the pattern on how to defeat them, the Treasure Chest chasing levels, and for those who want to complete every level with the highest amount of Lums and Electoons. This will make you want to retry/restart the level simultaneously, if you want to achieve perfection on this game.

That is from my experience. But don't let this discourage you. If you're a fan of the Rayman series, or you like a really creative, or challenging Platform game, this is definitely worth looking at.

17854074.review:
Beautiful. Vibrant. Humorous. Brutal. Fun. Special. To me, that is what sums up "Rayman Origins" in the best way possible. In a time where platformers have stopped showing up as often as they did in the 90's, it's very refreshing to see and play this game. I only wonder why I did not purchase this game on it's initial release date in 2011. So, I may be late to experience the joy that is "Rayman Origins", but I can say that it is a good quality platformer. There seems to be arguments on where in the Rayman timeline this game takes place. It was originally planned as a prequel to the original Rayman PS1 game, but it was scrapped at the last minute in favor of a new "story" (if you can even call it that) and is now mostly viwed upon as a reboot to the original Rayman. There is no meat on the story at all; just a pile of bare bones. But, who plays a platformer for the story, anyways? Just look at Mario. The visuals are absolutely breathtaking! The colors are vibrant and the animation is as smooth as butter. It may be nice on the eyes, but don't let that fool you into thiking it's going to be an easy or friendly childs game. I would say that the vast majority of levels are set to an "average" difficulty, but there are some that are much more unforgiving. Timing, momentum, and precision are key to succeeding these difficult areas. If you don't gain enough speed, it could lead to failure. If you run and jump, you could miss your target completely and fall to your demise. Even pressing the "A" button to jump, or lightly tapping it for a short jump can make the difference in hopping around pointy shards. In a screen-scrolling section of the game, I went through the whole level perfectly and just one little thing messed me up completely. As I was sliding down a tunnel, the end collapsed ever so slightly just before I got to that section and bonked Rayman on the head, resulting in a restart of the whole annoying level. The solution? Pressing down on the analog stick to make Rayman slide on his belly so he won't bump his head. It's those small things that can make the difference, and you have have to be fast to react. Also, it never feels cheap; you are always in control of whatever happens. The feeling of accomplishment is very great; just as you have FINALLY succeeded on a level that you have died on over and over again. To make it a little more fair, co-op is an option and it is a blast! Co-op is not something that I am very fond of, but in this game it works very well. This game may have some of the best controls of any 2D sidescrolling platformer out there; they are top-notch, very reactive, and tight, which is a very good thing for this type of game. The music is pretty nice, too. Maybe not as atmospheric or trance-like as the Donkey Kong Country series, but very nice, funny, and relaxing all at once. The only complaint I have is that the structure of the game feels a bit inconsistent at times. Instead of the levels going from easy, easy, hard, harder; it can be more like hardest, then easiest, then hard, then easy. The same applies for boss fights. The challenge posed by these bosses holds little correlation to the sequence through which they're unlocked. You may complete an absolutely horrowing level, only to fight a more-than-easy boss. Other times, you will beat an extremely easy level only to be pitted against a very difficult boss. But, I guess this concludes my review. Rayman Origins is a game I recommend to fans of 2D platformers and players who LOVE a challenge! Absolutely anyone can pick up a controller and learn to play this game within minutes, but it takes patience to complete it!

RATING - 8/10

17582133.review:
Rayman Origins ist ein 2D Jump 'n Run mit wunderbarer Optik. Die UbiArt Engine zaubert fantastische Umgebungen auf den Bildschirm; Grafikstil und Qualität der Animationen suchen ihresgleichen. Eine wirkliche Story bietet das Spiel dabei nicht wirklich. Viel mehr geht es darum, die abwechslungsreichen Level möglichst perfekt zu meistern. 

Neben der gelungenen visuellen Darstellung des Spiels kann sich auch der Sound sehen lassen. Im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes. Denn vor allem in den Unterwasser-Abschnitten wippen und singen die Lums und Fische mit der Melodie des eingängigen Soundtracks mit.

Vor allem im Koop-Modus für bis zu vier Spieler macht Rayman Origins einen Heidenspaß. Da fällt die Tatsache, dass circa ab der Hälfte des Spiels die Levelumgebungen größtenteils wiederholt werden, kaum negativ auf. Einige Sprung- und Kampfeinlagen sind allerdings derart schwierig, dass man sich im Mehrspielermodus häufig gegenseitig behindert anstatt sich zu helfen. Vor allem im letzten Drittel des Spiels sollte man sich darauf einstellen, viele Abschnitte häufiger zu spielen, bis man die perfekte Route erkannt hat. 

Rayman Origins kann ich jedem bedenkenlos empfehlen, der Spaß an hübschen Jump 'n Runs hat. Mit dem Spiel macht Ubisoft in der Hinsicht so ziemlich alles richtig.
