2842266.review:
My review will be divided in two parts: in an opinion as a gamer and in an opinion as a fan of Rayman. 

As a gamer, it is definitely a game worthy of the prizes that received back in 2011 by several identities including BAFTA, as "Best Platformer" and "Best Art Direction". It features more than twenty hours of longevity thanks to its 60+ levels, full of detail thanks to the wonderful job of the artists at Montpellier. It is a breeze of fresh air in the market of platforming games as an alternative to Mario, Sonic, etc. This game also supports cooperative gameplay. Chances are low that you will regret purchasing this, just check by yourself by playing the free demo!

As a Rayman fan, I honestly think the game had really a lot of potential to be better than what it turned out in the end. The game suffered significant changes during the development, ending up in something that wasn't quite "promised" back in the E3 of 2010. Keep in mind: "Origins" for the 2D side-scrolling gameplay (like Rayman 1), not "Origins" for the backstory of the most important characters. Don't expect the existence (and especially a coherent) of a story, since this pretty much lacks it. The levels are too linear and easy to overcome  especially if you have a sharp dexterity from Rayman 1. While the artwork is impressive, I think the artists were chosen bad for the background treatment, with just one or two exceptions. For me it is the least good Rayman title out of the four currenty existent, and after finishing it you won't wish to replay it very soon. In short, it is a good game but not as fantastic as the other main titles released before.

691994.review: I usually wait to the end of games to recommend them, but OMG I just love this game so much. From the frantic wall running, the insane cartoon graphics, down to the world design and the fact that it doesn't take itself that seriously. If you loved loose and crazy platformers post-Sonic and as far from the Mario formula as possible then Origins is exactly the game you want. Michael Ancel makes GREAT GAMES (read: Beyond Good and Evil) and jesus man he just nailed it with Rayman Origins. This is the most fun I've had in a game in a long time. Download the demo and see if my subjective and highly skewed recommendation beefs up to your own preconceptions. Wow, this game is great and exhilirating. Haven't felt this much speed since Sonic. 10/10 perfect and amazing.

5025465.review:
깔끔한 그래픽과 부드러운 에니메이션, 아름다운 음악이 어우러져 꽤 괜찮은 분위기를 자아낸다. 횡스크롤 아케이드임에도 불구하고 배경에 시원스럽게 깔린 자연은 묘하게 현실감마저 자아내고 있다.

레이맨 자체는 굉장히 오래된 프랜차이즈여서 어릴 적에 꽤나 재미있게 즐겼던 기억이 있다. 뜻하지 않게 본 게임을 선물 받아서 옛 추억도 되살려 볼 겸, 감사표시도 할 겸 한번 잡아 봤는데, 꽤나 몰입감 있는 게임이다. 하다보니 각 스테이지별 모아야 할 오브젝트들을 목표량 만큼 채워서 수집하느라 이미 돌았던 스테이지도 여러번 돌게 된다. 그래서인지 스피드 런으로 돌면 1분도 채 걸리지 않는 길이임에도 꽤 길게 느껴지게 된다. 다만 이걸 왜 모으고 있는지는 잘 모르겠다. 그저 모으는 것이 그리 어렵지 않으면서도 일종의 목표의식을 부여하여 게임의 난이도를 적당히 올려주는 재미도 있고, 왠지 메달을 다 받아놔야 안심이 되는 완벽주의자적인 성향을 자극하기 때문인 것 같다. 참, 캐릭터 언락 보상도 있기는 하다. 다만 레이맨으로만 하기 때문에, 별로 감흥은 없다.

같이 할 사람이 없어서 못해 봤지만, 친구와 한자리에 앉아서 로컬 멀티를 할 수 있는 것 같다. 4인까지 지원하는 것 같은데, 옛날의 아케이드 게임을 즐기던 향수를 불러 일으키는 요소다. 째즈 잭 레빗2와 비슷할까? 상상만 해본다.

난이도가 어렵지 않고, 시각과 청각을 즐겁게 해 주는 작품이기 때문에, 남녀노소가 쉽게 즐겨볼 수 있는 게임일 것이라 생각한다. 사실 말은 남녀노소지만, 나이드신 분들은 이정도만 돼도 많이 헤매실 것 같기는 하다. 그보다는 여자들이 즐길 수 있을 난이도와 아기자기함 이라는 부분에 집중하자. 나의 사랑스러운 여자친구에게 레이맨을 선물해서 게임계에 입문을 시켜 공통취미를 만들고, 장차 FPS까지 유도해서 함께 즐길 수 있게 된다면 이 어찌 좋지 아니한가? 다만, 여자친구를 만들 길이 없다는 사소한 문제가 있다.

1659900.review:
An incredibly solid platformer. Smooth, challenging, and utterly worthwhile. Rayman Origins, unlike most of the games in the series, is in touch with its roots, and recovers the same qualities that made the original Rayman such an excellent game. On the other hand, it isn't trapped in the past - this is no mere nostalgia trip, but its own distinct thing with its own unique playstyle and art style. 
It's not quite as expansive as the original Rayman, but still rewards exploration. and offers multiple objectives in a given level to make multiple playthroughs worthwhile.
Skill-wise,it gets reasonably tricky in the later levels, approaching Super Meat Boy in terms of difficulty. The level design has an excellent sense of flow. It's also pretty imaginitive, and evokes the feel of the original game's setting without copying it. 
The only criticism I have is that it feels very slightly unfinished in places - missing animations, boss fights that are a bit shorter than expected, a somewhat abrupt ending. Nothing that really hurts the game, one just feels that they could have given it another month or so of polish before release and it wouldn't have been a bad idea. 
If you're looking for a platformer, this is an excellent choice! (They have the original on GoG.com, too - go check that out if you've never played it!)

5650497.review:
You don't have to be a plumber to star in a great platforming game! Rayman is living proof of this; Rayman Origins has to be the most inventive, most hilarious, and most "feel-good" game I've played in a long time, in any genre. This isn't a game you can just breeze through, either, since it's extremely challenging and will seriously put your platforming skills to the test, especially in its later half. And if you want to reach the very most definitely last world, you'll have to get all ten Skull Teeth from some of the most challenging and fast-paced sequences, which give Super Meat Boy a run for its money (which is a great thing).

It has a large, phenominal soundtrack; a wacky sense of humor that doesn't feel forced at all; it controls like a dream; and its low system requirements mean that just about any computer can play it flawlessly while (also proving that demanding specs don't make good games). And on top of it, the graphics are absolutely gorgeous and shows just how lush and colorful hand-drawn graphics can be. Sure, it's not as cheap as other platformers on Steam, but trust me, except for the anti-climax at the end, it's worth every penny!

4192888.review:
Après avoir injustement été mis à l'écart par les lapins crétins, Rayman revient et nous prouve qu'Ubisoft est capable du meilleur. Et pour un retour, on peut parler d'un retour aux sources ! Il s'agit donc d'un jeu de plate-forme tout ce qu'il y a plus Old School si ce n'est que : 

1°) La réalisation en 2D est exemplaire (on a vraiment la sensation d'évoluer dans un dessin animé interactif) 
2°) La bande son est excellente si bien que de nombreux thèmes se graveront dans votre cerveau (celui de la chasse au coffre me sert de réveil en ce moment XD)
3°) L'humour omniprésent de l'univers d'Ancel vous fera souvent sourire, voir même rire aux éclats devant votre écran (mention spéciale pour les virées en moustique ridiculeusement épiques !). 

A travers ce jeu, nous redécouvrons un visage d'Ubisoft que l'on pensait disparu : celui d'un éditeur capable de prendre des risques artistiques et capable de donner de la fraîcheur à un genre tombé en désuétude. Certains reprocheront au jeu son inertie envahissante, je leur répondrait que RO n'est pas le seul jeu de plate - forme où il est nécessaire de gérer cet effet (les Sonic étant l'exemple le plus représentatif de ce type d'approche du genre). 

La durée de vie est convenable et se trouve allongée par le multijoueur. Les challenges sont variés et incitent à refaire les niveaux de fond en comble pour grappiller le moindre lums ou la moindre seconde au chronomètre. Un reproche cependant : même si le scénario ne constitue pas le coeur d'un jeu de plate - forme (cf Super Meat Boy), force est de constater qu'Ubi ne s'est pas beaucoup foulé pour donner à la trame un soupçon de cohérence. C'est d'autant plus dommage quand on sait que la série fut capable de nous raconter une histoire potable(Rayman 2 entre autre, -1).

 Mais le jeu reste cependant un des meilleurs représentants de son genre, et ce toutes périodes confondues. NB : l'usage du pad apporte un certain confort à la prise en main, aussi je vous le recommande. 

Pour les fans du tout premier Rayman (en fait de Rayman tout court), pour les amateurs de plate-forme à la recherche de challenge, et bien sûr pour les passionnés d'animation et de jeux vidéos !

19/20

959467.review:
One of the best 2d platformers I've played in years, and I wasn't even going into this with that high of expectations. 

Other than a few trial&error boss fights, this game does so many things right: very responsive and user-intuitive controls (which is the most important aspect of a platforming game), creative and fast-paced level designs that take advantage of those controls, and a steady, fair, and logical difficulty ramp that keeps increasing until end game. 

The music, art, and overall presentation also need honorable mentions - the game almost feels like interactive art in motion at times (screenshots and videos don't do it justice - gotta play it)

note: played on a gamepad, don't know how the game is on a keyboard

It's tough to find any flaws at all with Rayman Origins. The hand-drawn art style is breathtakingly gorgeous. The soundtrack is catchy. The controls are tight, responsive and fluid. The level design is excellent. It has a good level of difficulty that ramps up as the game progresses and the vast number of collectibles and challenges are a completionist's dream. And did I mention how unbelievably beautiful it is? The lack of online co-op is only slightly disappointing and not nearly enough to detract from the overall package.

As good a game as I've played all year. Pure 2D platforming bliss.

Beautifully animated, impeccably designed, and ridiculously hard to put down (especially when playing with a friend), if you're looking for a simple, good time then it's impossible to do any better than this.  The kind of pure, unadulterated, and ridiculously polished experience which this game offers is kind of a double-edged sword, however.  You'll know what I'm talking about once you play it, love it, and crave something else like it for the rest of your days as a gamer (knowing that the industry will probably never satisfy that craving).  Be aware of that risk before you jump into this one... but other than that, have fun!

471288.review:
Rayman Origins is an excellent side-scrolling 2D platformer. The animation and artwork is incredible, and you'll constantly be amazed at how well everything looks when in motion. The soundtrack is a bit crazy - the game uses a made-up babbling language for both its characters and the music, very reminiscent of LocoRoco's and still extremely catchy (though not nearly as mind-wormingly irritating long after playing). The platforming mechincs are extremely simple, and expand as you continue into the game. Environmental hazards, however, vary how you'll approach each stage, especially when you start attempting speed runs. 

Speaking of speed runs, one unfortunate omission is a lack of Steam achievements.  Though the game rewards certain tasks throughout the game, there are a lot of unique challenges missing from within the game that show up in the game's console counterpart. Regardless, the challenges are fun and the game as a whole does not hold back on difficulty. 

5 out of 5 foxes.

1143234.review:
Rayman has been around since the mid 1990s but the rapid success of the spin-off Raving Rabbids had left the main character behind and stuck in the background. But then one day, original creator Michel Ancel decided to bring the character to give the team a break from developing Beyond Good and Evil 2.

The return of the character as well as its return to its platforming roots has been very much celebrated. This is probably as good as platformers are ever going to get. The game has a fun, cartoony look and atmosphere to it, it doesn't take itself seriously at all and it completely blows away anything Sonic and Mario have done over the last 10 years.

The difficulty is spot on, no lives system here you just keep going, with checkpoints that are places so the game remains challenging without being frustrating, you'll never be wasting more then a minute of your time getting back to the point where you messed up.

The level environments and music are so well created its surreal. You can revisit any level you want to play from the game menu and the flow of the levels are so smooth. The game is long too, expect it to take a good 10 hours to get through, if you pace yourself.

Highly recommended if you love great platforming, wacky fun humour and a great art style to fit it all together with. No DRM either!

5348497.review: One of the best platformers I've played in a while, packed with loads of gameplay (20+ hours) and some really challenging levels towards the end. I can see this game going down well with both adults and kids, as the cute art style and soundtrack are just so loveable.

2066740.review:
Knowing how bad Ubisoft PC ports usually are, I did not expect to like this game. Boy was I in for a surprise.

The game is so much fun. Gameplay is your standard 2D platformer fare. You run and jump towards the end of the level, collecting yellow "lums" for a high score, and defeating enemies by jumping on their heads, or slapping them silly. Nothing out of the ordanary.

What makes this game stand out is just how joyful and fun it is. The graphics have a beautiful hand-painted look that call back to the old hand drawn Disney films. Levels are all unique and colorful, with environments having distinct feels. The music is catchy, with a mix of orchestral symphonies, and western country banjo playing. Levels are difficult and may take a few tries, but are nothing compared to the unrelenting difficulty PC platformers like Meat Boy usually ask. But most of all, the game is just fun to play.

TL;DR: This game is New Super Mario Brothers, but on the PC.

835959.review:
Delightful is what I'd use if I had to sum this game up in one word.

It's an old school sidescroller with a lot of modern day polish. For example, the difficulty is extremely well balanced. Most levels are simple enough for a child to get through, yet only the most hardcore players will be able to collect enough Lums (the game's version of coins) to get medals in each level without a lot of deaths. But that's okay, because dying in this game is relatively painless. There are no lives to lose, and the game will place you in the beginning of the section you were in nearly instantly (possibly taking a cue from Super Meat Boy?)

The art is gorgeous, the animation is smooth, and it has good controller support. The only negative I can think of is the lack of online multiplayer. But that's a tiny negative in a sea of positives.

3730442.review:
With rayman origins being the first rayman game since rayman 3 released in 2003 I was understanderbly nervous that this game would not meet my expectations especially with it's coop.  I was afraid that it would be a coop only game or a game that had features locked behind a coop wall.  Thankfully this is not the case.

Rayman Origins is a game that you don't need a friend to play.  It'll make your life much easier in the latter half of the game sure but it isn't required (and honestly on a computer playing with a friend can be rather cramped especially if there's going to be four of you in total).  Unfortunately the coop system is local meaning you can't play with friends over the internet.  This is silly really because I know a couple that want to play this game with me but as I said playing at a computer desk is cramped.  You can always wait for a steam machine but you might as well get this game for a console if your going to do that.

The game itself is very difficult in the latter half.  If your inexperienced with platformers you may rage quit.  There isn't any lives in this game so you won't be getting any game over screens like in mario but your patience will be tested to the limit.

The levels themselves aesthetically look beautiful you'd be hard pushed to find a game that looks better (not counting the sequel Rayman Legends).  With many hidden objects to locate you'll having a lot of fun if your the completionist.  If your not a completionist and just want to get from start to finish each level then your not going to have much luck seeing as in order to unlock bosses you need to collect a certain number of electoons.  The electoons aren't hard to find if you look but if you don't like playing hide and seek you can always collect a certain number of lums per level to get electoons or beat the level under a time limit.  There are other rewards if you go out of your way but they are only for bragging rights.

I would like to point out that the game support gamepad support, kinda.  You see connecting a gamepad isn't enough for the game to register it.  You have to calibrate the button mapping which is something you really shouldn't need to do with a platformer and it's a shame because the game is easier if you have a gamepad.

In terms of story it's...enjoyable however there is a rather large plothole that comes at the end of the game that ruins it a bit for me.  Now the story is very bare bones.  The glade of dreams gets invaded by the land of the livin' dead after Rayman and the clan are snoring too loudly and thats really all you need to know.  The story doesn't go much further after that but my problem is at the end.  I won't spoil it but lets just say it raises more questions rather than answering questions.

I reccomend playing the demo first to see if you'll like it.  Be warned the actual game is much harder than the demo and the graphical settings are no where near as in depth as they are in the demo (not sure why either).

Personally I think this game is the best in the franchise but I am yet to play Rayman Legends.  If you want a comparison to other platformers then I would have to say it is better than the original sonic games for the mega drive.  This game is worth the full price.

811504.review:
Another great 2D platformer. You can't call yourself a gamer if you have never played a Rayman game before. There's nothing more to say really. It's a platformer, with unlockable abilities and bossfights. But the bossfights... oh boy, remember Super Meat Boy ? Even Rayman Origins has several frustrating levels... and boss fights. It's the one thing that really annoyed me and took away a lot of fun at the same time. The boss fights require a certain pattern if you want to kill them. It will DEFINITELY take you a couple of tries for every boss fight there is. It's annoying and requires no skill whatsoever; just a good memory.
Thankfully the HD graphics make up for it... in a way.

[Rating: 85/100]

915501.review: Pretty sweet action/platforming game.  You may think its going to be a crappy console port, but suprising it is very well made and does not suffer from consolization at all.  Don't let the cartoony graphics fool you, this game is not a kiddy adventure that holds your hand and lets you win.  Some of the levels are rediculously hard and several times I was at controller throwing levels of frustration.  In terms of difficulty its right up there with the best platformers.  The music is great and the animation really drives the games humor which is suttle, and never takes itself to seriously.  The biggest selling point is the game is HALF the price of the console version, and will probably go on sale in the future.  All around a good buy if you like old school 2D platformers.

Finally rayman is back. With no stupid rabbids this time.
This is a must-have to any platforming games fan out there and other people that are not-so into platforming should give it a shoot too. This game also has some of the tightest controls ever.
I love the artistic value. The enviorments are so rich and there's so much going on. And it runs at solid 60 FPs. It's so much fun taking friends with you on the ride, i personally played through the entire with my friends using Xbox 360 controllers and it was so much fun.
Of course there are some minor flaws like cheap enemy placement on shooter levels it happens rarely and shooting levels aren't even 2/10 of the game so aside from that everying is almost perfect.
Last but not least it still have that nostolgic old rayman feel to it with the music, art and everything.

9.5/10

3409029.review:
AMAZING! 

I can't begin to express how much I love this game. The art style, music, gameplay, absolutely everything is perfect. This is one of my top 5 favorite games of all time and brings back memories of solid platformers on the SNES with the added polish of today's AAA titles. I would have paid thirty dollars for this games soundtrack alone. If you are ever in a bad mood, this is the cure. It is the single happiest most fun filled game I've played in 15 years. Gameplaywise, it's flawless. Airtight controls, perfect dfficulty curve, challenging, and overall extremely rewarding. There isn't enough room allowed here for me to praise everything Ubisoft did right with this game so all I can say is this game deserves far more attention than it has gotten. It fell under the radar a bit when it was released but I haven't talked with a single person who has played this and didn't love it.

Konečně jsme se dočkali i my PCčkáři. Láska na první pohled.. Nový Rayman přináší pestrobarevnou a oldschoolovou zábavu, která díky špatně rozmístěným checkpointům místy hraničí až s frustrací. To ovšem není problém celé hry, nýbrž několika levelů. Co ovšem tento sexy kousek trestuhodně postrádá je online multiplayer. Oproti konzolové verzi žádná změna, bohužel. Lokálně se s přáteli vyřádíte sice dosytosti, ale kde je sebrat zrovna v době, kdy máte chuť zaskotačit ve více lidech? Taktéž zamrzí chybějící Steamworks, ale kdo by čekal od kluků z Ubisoftu něco navíc, že. Ti se tentokrát "vytáhli" jiným způsobem. Hru totiž nebrzdí jejich DRM ochrana. Pokud vám Rayman už delší dobu chyběl, sáhněte po něm. Budete se skvěle bavit!

85% (chybí online multiplayer, místy frustrace)

5579097.review:
BEST...NON-MARIO PLATFORMER...EVER!!!!

There are a lot of things that make this game stand out as a true platformer and as a revival to the main Rayman series (Raving Rabbids was a stupid idea to begin with). Wonderful artistic style, challenging and visually complex level design, fresh soundtrack, solid controls, piss-easy bosses? Oh, well.

For the PC, the local co-op might be hard to enjoy as you would have to hook up 2 Xbox controllers or 2 keyboards and mouses to enjoy this game with a friend, which is a bit too much specifications for one game.

If you're a Rayman fan, buy this game. If you're a newcomer to platformers, buy this game. If you're a nostalgic fan, buy this game. This game pretty much is aimed for everyone. Enjoy!

Also...NO STEAM ACHIEVEMENTS!!!
